column1: 1 ^ Misericórdiam et judìcium cantábo tìbi Dòmine. ^ Mercy and judgment I will sing to thee
2 ^ Psallem et intèllegem in via immaculáta
column2: qŭando vènies ad me. Perambulábam in innocèntia cordis mei
column3: in mèdio domûs meaĕ. ^ I will sing and understand in the unspotted way
column4: when thou shalt come to me. I walked in the innocence of my heart
column5: in the midst of my house.

column1: 3 ^ Non proponébam ante òculos meos rem injústam~; facièntes praĕvaricatiónes odívi. ^ I will not set before my eyes any unjust thing; I hated the workers of iniquities.
4 ^ Non adháĕsit mìhi cor pravum~; declinántem a me malìgnum non cognoscébam. ^ The perverse heart did not cleave to me
column2: and the malignant that turned aside from me I would not know.

column4: qŭum hoc non edébam. ^ The man that in private detracted his neighbour
column5: him did I persecute; with him that had a proud eye

column2: ut sèdeant mecum~; ámbulans in via immaculáta
column3: hic mìhi ministrábat. ^ My eyes were upon the faithful of the earth
column4: to sit with me~; the man that walked in the perfect way

column1: 7 ^ Non habitábit in mèdio domûs meaĕ qŭi facit supèrbiam~; qŭi lóqŭitur iníqŭa non diréxit in conspèctu oculórum meórum. ^ He that worketh pride shall not dwell in the midst of my house; he that speaketh unjust things did not prosper before my eyes.
8 ^ In matutíno interficiébam omnes peccatóres terraĕ
column2: ut dispèrderem de civitáte Dòmini omnes operántes iniqŭitátem. ^ In the morning I put to death all the wicked of the land
column3: that I might cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of the Lord.
